00112 HyperGeometric::HyperGeometric( double mean, double variance )
00113   : pMean( mean ), pVariance( variance )
00114 {
00115     setState( );
00116 }

00119 //========================================================================
00163 HyperGeometric::HyperGeometric( double mean, double variance, RNG& r )
00164   : RandomVar< double >( r ), pMean( mean ), pVariance( variance )
00165 {
00166     setState( );
00167 }
00168 
00169 
00170 // Calculates the probability "p", i.e. the relation of the number of 
00171 // events of type T1 to the total number of events given
00172 // by "p = N1/N" from the stored mean value and the
00173 // variance. "p" will always be a real number greater than or equal
00174 // to zero. If the stored mean value is zero, then "p" will be set
00175 // to "0.", as for the default values "mean = 0" and "variance = 1".
00176 // Change: 2002-04-16, ra:
00177 // If the mean value is equal to zero or the calculation
00178 // of "p" results in a negative value then "p" will be set to "0." now.
00179 //
00180 void HyperGeometric::setState( )
00181 {
00182     if ( pMean == 0 ) 
00183     {
00184         pP = 0.;
00185         return;
00186     }
00187 
00188     double z = pVariance / ( pMean * pMean );
00189     pP = ( 1 - sqrt( ( z - 1 ) / ( z + 1 ) ) ) / 2;
00190 
00191     if ( pP < 0. ) pP = 0.;
00192     return;
00193 }
00194 
00195 
00196 
00197 //========================================================================
00222 void HyperGeometric::mean( double newMean )
00223 {
00224     pMean = newMean;
00225     setState( );
00226 }
00227 
00228 
00229 //========================================================================
00254 void HyperGeometric::variance( double newVariance )
00255 {
00256     pVariance = newVariance;
00257     setState( );
00258 }
00259 
00260 
00261 
00262 //========================================================================
00290 double HyperGeometric::operator( )( )
00291 {
00292     return -pMean * log( rng( ) ) / ( 2 * ( rng( ) > pP ? 1 - pP : pP ) );
00293 }
00294 
00295 
00296 
00297 //========================================================================
00318 double HyperGeometric::p( const double& x ) const
00319 {
00320     return 0.; // !!!
00321 }
